summary: The Railway Safety Act of 2025 aims to enhance rail safety regulations, particularly regarding the transportation of hazardous materials. Key provisions include stricter safety requirements for trains carrying hazardous materials, rail car inspection updates, mandatory defect detectors, a two-person crew requirement (with exceptions), increased civil penalties for safety violations, a phase-out of older tank cars, and increased funding for hazardous materials training for first responders. The bill also calls for a study on safer tank car technology and a report on implementation progress.
